storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive in-app alerts for scheduling conflicts to act immediately

testCases.title: Verify in-app alert displays upon scheduling conflict
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Application is open and active
At least one existing booking is present in the system
Conflict detection engine is operational
WebSocket or push notification service is connected

steps.action: Scheduler creates a new booking that conflicts with an existing booking (same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: In-app alert is displayed immediately on the screen with conflict notification

steps.action: Scheduler reviews the alert details displayed in the notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows accurate conflict information including conflicting booking IDs, resource names, time slots, and affected parties

steps.action: Scheduler clicks the acknowledge/dismiss button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from the interface and no longer visible on screen

postconditions: Alert has been dismissed from the UI
Conflicting booking remains in the system until manually resolved
Alert dismissal is logged in the system

testCases.title: Ensure alerts persist until user dismissal or conflict resolution
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Application is open and active
A scheduling conflict exists in the system
In-app alert for the conflict has been triggered

steps.action: Scheduler receives alert for an unresolved conflict and observes the alert on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert remains visible and prominently displayed in the application interface

steps.action: Scheduler navigates to different pages within the application without taking action on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert persists on screen across different pages and remains visible until action is taken

steps.action: Scheduler clicks the dismiss button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from the screen and no longer displayed

postconditions: Alert is no longer visible in the UI
Underlying conflict still exists in the system
User dismissal action is recorded

testCases.title: Test alert delivery latency under 1 second
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Application is open and active
System performance monitoring tools are available
Conflict detection engine is operational
Timer or timestamp logging is enabled

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when a scheduling conflict is created (e.g., by creating overlapping booking)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection event is triggered and timestamp is captured

steps.action: Observe when the in-app alert appears on the screen and record the timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Alert appears in the application interface and display timestamp is captured

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between conflict creation and alert display
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than 1 second, meeting the performance requirement

postconditions: Alert delivery latency is measured and documented
Performance metrics are logged
Alert is displayed on screen

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive email notifications for scheduling conflicts to stay informed when away from the app

testCases.title: Verify email notification is sent upon scheduling conflict
preconditions: User is registered as a Scheduler with a valid email address
Email notification service (SMTP) is configured and operational
Conflict detection engine is active
Email notification preferences are enabled for the user
Test email inbox is accessible for verification

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by booking a resource that overlaps with an existing booking
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection event is triggered and email notification generation process begins

steps.action: Wait up to 5 minutes and check the scheduler's email inbox for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Email with conflict details is received in the inbox, containing subject line indicating scheduling conflict

steps.action: Open the email and review its content
steps.expectedResult: Email contains detailed conflict information including conflicting booking IDs, resource names, time slots, affected parties, and actionable links

postconditions: Email notification has been successfully delivered
Email content is accurate and complete
Delivery is logged in the email service

testCases.title: Test user preference configuration for email notifications
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
User settings or preferences page is accessible
Email notification feature is available in user preferences
Default notification preferences are set

steps.action: Navigate to user settings/preferences page and locate email notification settings
steps.expectedResult: Email notification preferences section is displayed with toggle or checkbox options

steps.action: Update email notification preferences (e.g., enable or disable conflict notifications) and save changes
steps.expectedResult: Preferences are saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict event in the system
steps.expectedResult: Email is sent or suppressed according to the saved preferences (email received if enabled, not received if disabled)

steps.action: Verify email inbox matches the configured preference setting
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery behavior matches the user's preference configuration

postconditions: User preferences are persisted in the system
Email notification behavior reflects updated preferences
Preference changes are logged

testCases.title: Ensure email delivery success rate is above 99%
preconditions: Email service is configured and operational
Test environment has access to email delivery monitoring tools
Multiple valid test email addresses are available (minimum 100)
Conflict detection can be triggered programmatically or in batch
Email delivery tracking and logging is enabled

steps.action: Prepare a batch of at least 100 scheduling conflicts that will trigger email notifications to different valid email addresses
steps.expectedResult: Batch of conflict events is ready for execution with corresponding recipient email addresses

steps.action: Trigger all conflict events and initiate email notification sending process
steps.expectedResult: Email service processes all notification requests and attempts delivery to all recipients

steps.action: Monitor email delivery status using email service logs or delivery reports for all sent emails
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is tracked for each email (delivered, bounced, failed)

steps.action: Calculate the delivery success rate by dividing successfully delivered emails by total emails sent
steps.expectedResult: At least 99% of emails are marked as successfully delivered (99 out of 100 minimum)

postconditions: Email delivery metrics are documented
Success rate meets or exceeds 99% threshold
Any failed deliveries are logged for investigation

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to acknowledge and dismiss conflict alerts to manage my notifications

testCases.title: Verify user can acknowledge and dismiss conflict alerts
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with valid credentials
User has permissions to manage alerts
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Alert management system is operational
User session is authenticated

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts section where conflict alerts are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Alerts section loads successfully and displays all active conflict alerts

steps.action: Verify that the conflict alert is visible in the UI with all relevant details (resource, time, severity)
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed in UI with complete information including alert type, timestamp, and affected resources

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Acknowledge' button on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Acknowledged' with visual indicator (e.g., color change, icon update, or status label)

steps.action: Verify the acknowledge action is reflected in the alert display
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows acknowledged status and remains visible in the interface

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Dismiss' button on the acknowledged alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is immediately removed from the UI within 1 second

steps.action: Verify the dismissal action is logged by checking the audit log or system logs
steps.expectedResult: Dismissal action is logged with user ID, timestamp, and alert ID in the system logs

steps.action: Refresh the alerts page or navigate away and return to verify alert persistence
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert does not reappear in the alerts list

postconditions: Alert is removed from the active alerts interface
Dismissal action is logged with user and timestamp information
Alert status is updated to 'Dismissed' in the database
User can continue managing other alerts without interference

testCases.title: Ensure dismissed alerts do not reappear unless conflict persists
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with valid credentials
User has permissions to manage alerts
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Alert management system is operational
User session is authenticated

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts section and identify an active conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Active conflict alert is displayed in the UI with all details

steps.action: Acknowledge the conflict alert by clicking the 'Acknowledge' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Acknowledged'

steps.action: Dismiss the alert by clicking the 'Dismiss' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from the UI immediately and dismissal is logged

steps.action: Wait for 5 seconds without making any changes to the underlying conflict
steps.expectedResult: No changes occur in the system; conflict status remains unchanged

steps.action: Refresh the alerts page or navigate away and return to the alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert does not reappear in the alerts list

steps.action: Verify the alert remains dismissed by checking the alerts dashboard multiple times over a 2-minute period
steps.expectedResult: Alert does not reappear as long as the conflict status remains unchanged

steps.action: Simulate a change in conflict status by resolving the underlying conflict in the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is marked as resolved in the system

steps.action: Recreate the same conflict condition that triggered the original alert
steps.expectedResult: System detects the new conflict occurrence

steps.action: Check the alerts dashboard for new alert generation
steps.expectedResult: A new alert is generated and displayed in the UI for the reoccurring conflict

steps.action: Verify the new alert has a different alert ID and timestamp than the previously dismissed alert
steps.expectedResult: New alert has unique identifier and current timestamp, confirming it is a new alert instance

postconditions: Dismissed alert remains dismissed when conflict status is unchanged
New alert is generated only when conflict reoccurs after resolution
Alert management system correctly distinguishes between dismissed and new alerts
System maintains data integrity for alert lifecycle management

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view conflict alerts on a dashboard to monitor scheduling issues

testCases.title: Verify dashboard displays active conflict alerts
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with valid credentials
User has authenticated scheduler access to the dashboard
Multiple active conflict alerts exist in the system with varying resources, times, and severity levels
Conflict alert database is accessible and operational
Dashboard application is running and accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict dashboard by clicking on the dashboard menu or accessing the dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: Conflict dashboard loads successfully and displays the main interface

steps.action: Verify that all active conflict alerts are displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows a complete list of active conflict alerts with key information (resource name, time, severity, alert ID)

steps.action: Check that each alert displays relevant details including resource, timestamp, and severity level
steps.expectedResult: Each alert entry shows complete information in a clear, readable format

steps.action: Locate the filter options on the dashboard (resource filter, time filter, severity filter)
steps.expectedResult: Filter controls are visible and accessible on the dashboard interface

steps.action: Apply a resource filter by selecting a specific resource from the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Alerts list updates immediately to show only alerts related to the selected resource

steps.action: Clear the resource filter and apply a severity filter by selecting a specific severity level
steps.expectedResult: Alerts list updates to display only alerts matching the selected severity level

steps.action: Apply a time filter by selecting a specific time range or date
steps.expectedResult: Alerts list updates to show only alerts within the specified time range

steps.action: Apply multiple filters simultaneously (resource + severity + time)
steps.expectedResult: Alerts list updates to show only alerts matching all applied filter criteria

steps.action: Clear all filters to return to the full list of active alerts
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays all active conflict alerts again

steps.action: Select a specific conflict alert from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the detailed conflict view showing comprehensive information about the selected alert

steps.action: Verify the detailed view contains complete conflict information including affected resources, timeline, severity, and resolution options
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict view displays all relevant information in an organized format

steps.action: Navigate back to the dashboard from the detailed view
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard reloads with the same filter settings and alert list as before

postconditions: Dashboard displays accurate and current conflict alert information
Filter functionality works correctly for all filter types
Navigation to detailed views functions properly
User can effectively monitor and manage scheduling conflicts
Dashboard state is maintained during navigation

testCases.title: Ensure dashboard data refreshes within 2 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with valid credentials
User has authenticated scheduler access to the dashboard
Conflict dashboard is open and displaying current alerts
System has capability to generate new conflict alerts
Real-time data refresh mechanism is enabled
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Open the conflict dashboard and note the current number of active alerts displayed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads with current list of active conflict alerts and count is visible

steps.action: Prepare a timer or stopwatch to measure the refresh time
steps.expectedResult: Timer is ready to measure the time between alert generation and dashboard update

steps.action: Generate a new conflict alert in the system (through backend process, API call, or by creating a scheduling conflict)
steps.expectedResult: New conflict alert is successfully created in the system and stored in the conflict alert database

steps.action: Start the timer immediately after the new conflict alert is generated
steps.expectedResult: Timer begins counting to measure refresh latency

steps.action: Observe the dashboard without manually refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically updates to display the new conflict alert

steps.action: Stop the timer when the new alert appears on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Timer shows the elapsed time between alert generation and dashboard display

steps.action: Verify that the elapsed time is 2 seconds or less
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refresh time is within the 2-second performance requirement

steps.action: Verify the new alert displays with correct information (resource, time, severity)
steps.expectedResult: New alert shows accurate and complete information matching the generated conflict

steps.action: Check that the alert count has increased by one
steps.expectedResult: Total alert count on dashboard reflects the addition of the new alert

steps.action: Repeat the test by generating another new conflict alert and measuring refresh time again
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard consistently updates within 2 seconds for the second alert as well

postconditions: Dashboard demonstrates real-time refresh capability within performance requirements
New alerts are displayed accurately and promptly
Automatic refresh mechanism functions without manual intervention
Dashboard maintains data integrity during real-time updates
Performance metrics meet the 2-second refresh requirement
